title: eBIZ-TCF: An Initiative to Improve eAdoption in European Textile/Clothing and Footwear Industry

author: Milena Stefanova, Computing and Modelling Unit, ENEA Casaccia Research Center

segmentation: In their agency for Sustainable Development, which main goal is to support local SMS in their innovation practices?
So I'm going to present you the project if it's a TCF which is.
Project caught by the European Commission DG Enterprise.
It was a tender of the gentle price.
It's not a research project, and the goal of this project is to facilitate the large scale adoption of the business in the textile, clothing and footwear industries.
The project started in January 2028 and is going to finish indent of this year.
Currently there are more than 160 companies and European organizations involved in this project.
Shut down objective of the project is to create a favorable environment for the European textile, clothing and footwear industries.
That stimulation tables, uptake of ICT, anti business technologies in the sectors.
There are three main outcomes of the project.
First is the definition of general architecture for the business, which is compliant to existing specific standard specification, European and international.
For Vectibix transactions in the textile, clothing and footwear sectors.

The second outcome of the project is the creation of extensive set of pilots that actual adopt and that harmonized standard specifications created in the general architecture and the third outcome is to create a broader awareness and acceptance by European stakeholders.

Outline the methodology followed by the project.
This is not a research project so there is no research products or innovative products.
But what is innovative here is the methodology that is followed to stimulate the uptake of standard specifications by the small and medium enterprises in the sector.
So the methodology is having four parts.

The first one is analysis for in the first six months of the project we performed an analysis of the state of the art in the adoption of ICT into business solutions by the small to medium companies in in the three sectors.
As well, we have performed the state of the art analysis on the existing standard specifications and standardization and.
Other kinds of initiatives.
So the second part was the definition of what we call business architecture.

So that architecture has is not ICT architecture, it is just a set of standards documented in a harmonized way that our mapping to various processes and documents exchanging business transactions among active players in the in the three sectors.
And then we have defined the indications about this, IT infrastructures and the standards that has to be used on the.
I stand firm in the world levels.
Then the next step in our methodology is the creation of.

A set of pilot projects that actually adopted the standard specifications with switching their earpiece systems and their scope is to validate the architecture and to provide feedback for improvements.
But the ultimate objective is to create large scale impact and best practices.
Currently there are 13 pilot projects running with more than 130 end users that are adopting the standard specifications.
And the last part of the project is the creation of the awareness and dissemination through the two European associations.

So the analysis that comes of the analysis was that first there are a large number of European enterprises that are involved in some kind of business activity and they are mainly concentrated in Western and Central Europe.
But more often the number of electronic transactions exchanges are small.
There are a small small number of connections and supported functions.
And the search electronic transactions are limited to one or two large trading partners which demand use of their systems.

The producer to retailer connections while in the upstream part there are few companies that are using transactions, electronic transactions and downstream systems are more diffused.
In western central Europe, while southern Europe is preferring the use of such systems on the upstream part of the supply chain.
And for some obstacles that.
